intro: Bulbophyllum uroplatoides, commonly known as the narrow-leafed ghost orchid, is a rare and striking orchid native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, linear leaves and unique, pale green or white flowers. This epiphytic plant typically grows on trees or rocks, relying on atmospheric moisture for survival. Its botanical features include a short rhizome and a single, showy inflorescence with several small, fragrant flowers. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is often difficult to cultivate outside its natural environment.
